articles.title: Humans, not climate change, may have wiped out Australia’s giant kangaroos - Science News Magazine
articles.description: About 40,000 years ago, giant kangaroos vanished Down Under. Dental analyses suggest a varied diet, meaning climate change was not the main cause.
articles.content:
The demise of most of Australias kangaroo species by 40,000 years ago may have had less to do with climate-caused dietary pressures and more to do with human hunters.
